intro: Cherleria laevis, commonly known as the smooth cherleria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, often glabrous stems and leaves that are typically lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Cherleria laevis is primarily cultivated for its ornamental value and has limited use in traditional medicine.
